Talk_67:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Greeting_01>I'm going to work hard for my big sister.
Just watch, I'll be a fashion designer who
changes the world!
Talk_50:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>I feel a lot better after talking to you.
Thanks for listening!

I'll keep experimenting with recipes until
I come up with a <clr:0000>porridge that works on
gloom sickness<clr:ffff>!
Talk_68:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:LaughS_00>You can't get anything by her, Lasli.
Besides, everyone knows studying fashion
in <clr:0000>Hateno Village<clr:ffff> is your dream!
Grandmother and I can take care of
<clr:0000>Enchanted<clr:ffff> by ourselvesâ€”trust me. You
deserve this.
Talk_69:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Ease_00>Well, now that Grandmother's all better,
I think it's time I head back to the shop.

I've got to make sure our prices are
back to normal and everything's ready
for our customers.
Talk_51:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>...<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:Notice_00>Huh? <sp:5:0:0>Oh, uh... Welcome.<sp:5:0:0> Sorry. I must
have drifted off. I'm just so tired lately.

<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Think>*sigh* Look, I know it won't help to talk
about it, but I'm gonna do it anyway.
My grandmother's really sick.
I'm running the shop while my little sister,
<clr:0000>Lasli<clr:ffff>, is looking after her.<sp:5:0:0> We're sort of
getting by...
But we're both so exhausted.<sp:5:0:0>
Talk_93:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal>What? <sp:5:0:0>You don't believe that veggie
porridge can be tasty?
Talk_52:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Tired_01>Thank you for your concern. All I can do
now is make sure that I never lose heart.
Talk_53:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_00>Hey, look! <sp:5:0:0>Are you seeing this?!


A few bites of your sunny veggie porridge,
and it's like she was never even sick!
Talk_94:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Now that I'm feeling better,<sp:5:1:0> you should
hurry and prepare for your journey, Lasli.
Talk_54:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Think_00>You see, my grandmother's sick in bed
with a <clr:0000>strange illness<clr:ffff>, and my little sister,
<clr:0000>Lasli<clr:ffff>, volunteered to take care of her.
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Lasli was supposed to be studying fashion
out southeast in Hateno Village by now...

But she loves our grandmother so much
that she's put her dreams on hold.
Talk_96:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>She's just getting worse and worse...<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0>I need to hurry and make her a <clr:0000>porridge
that will help with her gloom sickness<clr:ffff>...
Talk_80:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:Happy_01>Grandmother, your complexion!<sp:5:0:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0801>The color's coming back to your cheeks!<sp:5:0:0>
Talk_57:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:TalkPositive_01>So you were the one who made that
porridge for me.

Such a gentle flavor. It didn't just nourish
my body but my spirit too.<sp:0:4:0>Thanks to you and my granddaughter, it
seems I'll be around for a long time yet.
I'm so grateful to the both of you.
Talk_16:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Ugh, I know I shouldn't bring my <clr:0000>home
situation<clr:ffff> into the shop with me...
Talk_40:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Tired_01>Normally, I run a clothing shop called
<clr:0000>Enchanted<clr:ffff> near the Ring Ruins.

But in my illness, I've entrusted the shop
entirely to my granddaughter <clr:0000>Claree<clr:ffff>.

I want to get better quick so I can help
her, but, well, you can see how my
recovery is going...
Talk_41:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Think_01>I don't really know anything about it
myself, other than what it does to you
when you touch it.
My grandmother was cleaning up <clr:0000>East Hill<clr:ffff>
for the survey team when she first noticed
the <clr:0000>chasm<clr:ffff>...
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>We know now that the chasm's a source
of <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff>, but she had no idea. When she
tried to take a look, she got exposed.<sp:5:0:0>
But there's got to be an <clr:0000>ingredient that
counteracts gloom sickness <clr:ffff>somewhere
out there...right?
Talk_59:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Happy_00>Oh, Claree. I'm so sorry I worried you.<clr:0000><clr:ffff>


But this nice young man made me a
wonderful sunny veggie porridge, so
I'm feeling much better now.
Talk_42:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Are you a traveler?<sp:5:1:0> I guess it doesn't
really matter who you are, so long as
you're willing to listen.
You see, it's my grandmother...<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0>She got too close to that nasty <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff>
stuff, and now she's sick and bedridden.<sp:0:4:0><clr:0000>Porridge<clr:ffff> is about the only thing she
can keep down right now too.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>I've been trying to mix in <clr:0000>ingredients that
could help with gloom sickness<clr:ffff>...<sp:0:4:0>But none of them have had any effect.<sp:0:4:0>I need to cook a <clr:0000>porridge<clr:ffff> that will
make my grandmother better, and
I need to do it soon.
Talk_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Sad_01>I don't know who you are, but I'm sorry
you have to see me like this.

I'm dealing with an illness, and don't have
the strength to get up...

If this is about the clothing shop, please
talk to Claree.
Talk_43:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Wait, are you looking into a cure for
gloom for me? <sp:5:0:0>Thank you! <sp:5:0:0>I just hope
you can find something...
Talk_84:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice_00>Oh, right. That was you who bought the
overpriced clothes at <clr:0000>Enchanted<clr:ffff>...

Sorry about that. Let me refund you the
difference between the markup and the
proper price.
Talk_46:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:Notice_01>Huh?<sp:5:0:0> What is that gentle aroma?
Is that porridge I smell?<sp:5:0:0>

Could it be? Did you make a porridge that
could help with gloom sickness?!
Talk_88:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Think>I'm sorry about this,<sp:5:0:0> but we really need
money for Grandmother's treatment.

I've had to <clr:0000>hike up the prices <clr:ffff>on
everything we have in stock.

It's just for now though. As soon as
Grandmother is healthy again, I can 
<clr:0000>set our prices back to normal<clr:ffff>.
Talk_71:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>Thanks to you, I'm actually going to get
to study fashion in <clr:0000>Hateno Village<clr:ffff> with a
clear conscience.
But Hateno Village is far to the east, on
the edge of Necluda, so I won't be able to
come home to Kakariko very often.
<sp:3:0:2:0501>I'm actually a bit nervous about going on
my own...<sp:5:0:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS_01>But I'd be happy if you came to visit
me sometime!
Talk_49:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>Thank you, Lasli. That was the first meal
I've been able to finish in quite a while.
Talk_76:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><clr:0000><snd:Chat_00><clr:ffff>It's my grandmother's favorite, made of
<clr:0000>Hylian rice<clr:ffff>, <clr:0000>fresh milk<clr:ffff>, and <clr:0000>wild greens<clr:ffff>.

You might not normally think to mix those
ingredients,<sp:5:0:0> but it's surprisingly good.

I bought a bunch of Hylian rice and milk
from the <clr:0000>merchants<clr:ffff> who travel the <clr:0000>road<clr:ffff>
to the west, so I'm not hurting for those.
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>But I still haven't found that crucial
<clr:0000>ingredient that fights off gloom sickness<clr:ffff>...
Talk_36:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Think_00>What to do?<sp:5:0:0> At this rate, Grandmother's
health isn't going to... <sp:5:0:0>Ugh. And Claree's
so busy running the <clr:0000>clothing shop<clr:ffff>...<sp:0:4:0>I'll just have to do it myself. I'll find a
<clr:0000>cure <clr:ffff>for my grandmother.
Talk_77:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseS_01>Wh-what did you say this was, again?
<sp:5:0:0>A sunny veggie porridge?

<sp:3:0:2:0b01>I've never made anything "sunny" before.<sp:5:0:0>
Maybe this will help my grandmother!
Talk_78:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Oh, it's you again.<sp:5:0:0> Did you come back
because you were worried about
my grandmother?
If I knew this would happen, I never would
have let her go help the research team.

If she hadn't volunteered to put herself
in danger, she wouldn't have been
exposed to the <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff> and gotten sick...
She's still so weak, <clr:0000>porridge<clr:ffff> is the only
thing she can eat.

<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I've tried mixing in different ingredients,
hoping to find one<clr:0000> that helps with gloom
sickness<clr:ffff>, but none have worked...
I need to make a <clr:0000>porridge<clr:ffff> that will help
my grandmother, and soon.
Talk_60:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Notice_01>Hold on.<sp:5:0:0> You're doing this much better...
<sp:5:0:0>after one bowl of porridge?!<sp:5:0:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0701>I guess I knew that was Lasli's plan, <sp:5:0:0>but
I'm still amazed it actually worked.
Talk_79:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad_00>If I knew this would happen, I never would
have let her go help the survey team.

If she hadn't volunteered to put herself
in danger, she wouldn't have been
exposed to the <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff> and gotten sick...
I've tried mixing different ingredients into
her <clr:0000>porridge<clr:ffff>, hoping to find one<clr:0000> that
helps with gloom sickness<clr:ffff>, but no luck.
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I need to make a <clr:0000>porridge<clr:ffff> that will help
my grandmother, and soon.
Talk_38:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_00>Wishful thinking, I suppose...<sp:0:4:0>Oh, Grandmother... What will I do if you
don't get better?

<sp:0:2:2:5000>*sniffle*<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_61:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Claree...are you sure you don't want to
go study with her?
Talk_62:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Think_01>Well, <sp:5:0:0>I'd be lying if I said I didn't...


But there's something else I want more.<sp:5:0:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0101>I want to make <clr:0000>Enchanted<clr:ffff> a success, right
here in my beloved Kakariko Village, right
next to my beloved grandmother. <sp:5:0:0>And...
Talk_39:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Tired_01>The other day when I was cleaning up the
hill, I got too close to the chasm...

That's when I accidentally touched that
"gloom." It seems to have taken quite a
toll on me at my age.
But don't worry. I'm all right for now... <sp:5:0:0>My
granddaughter <clr:0000>Lasli<clr:ffff> is looking after me.

She should be just outside the house.


The poor girl is very worried about me.<sp:5:0:0>
I need to get better soon...
Talk_64:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive_00>I dream of someday filling our store wall
to wall with outfits you designed, Lasli!

So don't worry about me. Go study hard
in <clr:0000>Hateno Village<clr:ffff>, and come back to us a
fashion icon!
Talk_24:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><clr:0200><sp:3:0:2:0c01>It's nice to get it off my chest, but I probably
shouldn't have dumped all that on a customer...<clr:ffff><sp:0:4:0><clr:0200>OK, time to salvage my professionalism.<clr:ffff><sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm so sorry about that. Allow me to
welcome you to Enchanted!
Talk_66:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_00>Thank you so much for your help.<sp:5:0:0>


I made a lot of porridge trying to find a
cure for my grandmother. We won't be
able to eat it all ourselves.
I think it turned out pretty tasty though,
so I'd love to give you some to take on
your journey.
